roleset.name: vision, look
roleset.note: LOOKIT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'lookit' based on sentences in brown. (from lookit.01-v)
LOOK-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls rummage-35.5, peer-30.3. (from look.01-n)

roles.note: Watch out for Light Verbs!This frame differs from the corresponding verbal frame in the absence of arg2, attribute. No such examples have been observed, and they seem unlikely. Could be added if necessary. (from look.01-n)

role.descr: thing looked at or for or on

example.name: look-v: just transitive
example.text: A student was looking at a crib sheet.

example.name: look-v: intransitive with direction
example.text: He never looked back.

example.name: look-v: look for
example.text: A number of participants were looking for an index above 50.

example.name: look-v: object control
example.text: Bush administration officials look to the Fed to bring down rates.

example.name: lookit-v: imperative
example.text: [*] Lookit it ! !

example.name: look-n: autogen1
example.text: the Treasury 's look at plans for giving new tax breaks ondividends and raising taxes on short-term trades by pension funds
example.arg: at plans for giving new tax breaks on dividends and raising taxes on short-term trades by pension funds

example.name: look-n: autogen2-- make sure this isn't part of a light verb construct though!
example.text: a look at some of the alternatives

example.name: look-n: Light Verb!
example.text: When the job was finished the manager and I had a look at the finished product.

example.name: look-n: with MNR
example.text: an up - close and personal look at the President 's Supreme Court nominee
example.arg: at the President's Supreme Court nominee

example.name: look-n: Light Verb!
example.text: Have you taken a look at your bones?

roleset.name: seeming, appear/seem
roleset.note: LOOK-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. Member of Vncls stimulus_subject-30.4. (from look.02-v)
LOOK-N NOTES: Updated by Julia. Member of Vncls stimulus_subject-30.4.. (from look.02-n)
LOOKING-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from looking.02-j)

roles.note: Arg2, the experiencer, left off for now. If it actually shows up, it could be added. (from look.02-n)

example.name: look-v: look like
example.text: Administrators look like they take cheating seriously.

example.name: look-v: look to be
example.text: Stock prices might look fairly high.

example.name: look-v: with viewer
example.text: It looked to me like an attempt to push the dollar down.
example.arg: like an attempt to push the dollar down

example.name: look-n: autogen1
example.text: The beautiful look of wool , '' croons the show 's narrator , ``slightly Victorian in its influence

example.name: look-n: autogen2
example.text: the monochrome look

example.name: look-n: another arg1
example.text: a more youthful and contemporary look

example.name: look-v: subject control
example.text: People are looking *trace* to stake their claims

roleset.name: discourse: attend to this
roleset.note: LOOK-V NOTES: Usually "You" is not explicit. Added by Jena (from look.09-v)

example.name: look-v
example.text: *PRO* Look, I don't want to wax philosophic, but I will say that if you're alive you've got to flap your arms and legs, you've got to jump around a lot, for life is the very opposite of death, and therefore you must at very least think noisy and colorfully, or you're not alive.

example.name: look_forward-v: look forward
example.text: They're looking forward to their winter meeting.

example.name: look_up-v: no source
example.text: (Some courts release names and addresses, and researchers can drive by houses, look up credit ratings, and even question neighbors.)

example.name: look_up-v: all args
example.text: John had to look up the word 'idiot' in the dictionary.

example.name: look_over-v: split particle
example.text: Wilson came by train from Birmingham and looked the city over; the rather pleasant white city was on the hill where the chief stores were [*T*-1] .

example.name: look_over-v:
example.text: During the next weeks he looked over the situation .

example.name: look_after-v: automatically generated
example.text: But there was one thing that he had [*-1] to stress [*T*-2], and that was that the contribution to the general church expenses , the dollar money , had been seriously falling behind in this church , and that-3 must be looked after [*-3] immediately .

example.name: look_out-v:
example.text: Whoever *T* heard of a father looking out for other people's kids?!

roleset.name: regard with contempt
roleset.note: LOOK_DOWN-V NOTES: Roleset based on instances in the New Testament. No corresponding VN class. (from look.10-v)

example.name: look_down-v: All arguments
example.text: There were some people who thought they were very good and looked down on everyone else .

roleset.name: investigate
roleset.note: LOOK_INTO-V LOOKING_INTO-N NOTES: Added by Julia for AMR.

example.name: look_into-v
example.text: I didn't ask them for anything other than make sure they look into this.
